Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: bwolsen
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paris once before and stayed north of the City Centre by the Madeline Cathedral. This time we opted to stay south of the City Centre. You save money by not being right near the attractions and the Metro keeps everything within minutes. This hotel is with 50 yards of the metro entrance and you can be literally anywhere within minutes. The price was around $100 euros a night does NOT come with the breakfast which was fine with us as we generally stopped and a crepe stand nearby. Who can resist? The rooms are decent for Europe and ours had a full sized shower. Our windows opened up to the street below and we found taht it could get a little loud at night with all the mopeds and motorcycle traffic. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone traveling as a couple or single person. Our room was definately not ideal for families. The staff was very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for a great price!!”
Reviews.Author: damiengibson
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel has no parking, there is an underground multi story car park only a short walk away which was around 15 euros a day. Check in was quick and easy and staff were very friendly and spoke good English. The rooms were modest and actually have small balconies which over look the bustling street below that are big enough to sit down on with a glass of wine. Although it is located on a busy road, when the windows are shut, it's not actually that noisy. The hotel is conveniently located less than a 100 yards from an underground train station which means you have access to the whole city. It's not actually far to walk to the Eifel tower neither. We had a pleasant weekend in Paris and a very pleasant stay at Hotel Innova and would recommend to anyone on a budget let alone stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Warm yellow room”
Reviews.Author: Norwegian_Couple25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple og nights on a business trip. The hotel is fairly reasonable, and situated in the montparnasse/vaugirard area. The staff working at the hotel are very polite, and the rooms are kept in a clean state. the breakfast is a bit dissappointing as the selection is quite limited, but the obligatory croissants and other sweet things are present. The reason I rate this hotel only average is due to the room; it is is small, warm and a bit claustropobic with its yellow walls. THere was a balcony out to the main street which is nice, but is sadly does not save the room. I have tried various hotels in the same area and price class, and the rooms seperates them. I would probably not live here again, but not recommend against it.

Reviews.Title: “near transportation”
Reviews.Author: Gamze S
Reviews.Content: the hotel was near transportation.clean and wi-fi was free.location is not that good but if you like to walk you can walk to eifel tower. eifel tower looks almost from everywhere. at first we saw eifel we think hotel is near eifel.it is not that near but the hotel is enough good.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are the nicest people I've ever met”
Reviews.Author: Oonagh K
Reviews.Content: Rooms are basic,but very very clean.We had a view of the Eiffel Tower out our window!!! Location is great,right beside the Pasteur Metro which serves Line 6 and 12(two of the best).Plenty of restaurants and cafes in the vicinity.Wifi was free.All of the staff were so so HELPFUL and FRIENDLY.They booked our River cruise on the Seine(which was brill and way cheaper than approaching them on the pier).Gave us recommendations all the time for nightlife,where to go etc.Booked taxis,even posted our postcards.There were 8 of us(all woman) and all of us said that we would definetely return to this hotel.I signed up to Tripadvisor,I felt so strongly about giving them a review that they deserve.Price was great as well.Thank you Hotel Innova for making paris so wonderful for us.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, nice staff, common and simple room...”
Reviews.Author: Svetlana_Jam
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel on their site. So the price was a bit lower than it is at the reception but it was taken 5,5 euro for reservation. The most wonderful property of this hotel is its super location and absolutely safe surrounding area. It is located 3 minutes on foot from the Underground station (two lines!), in the nice, clean (for Paris) boulevard Pasteur. Besides two lines of the Metro, there is Bus line 95, that connects Montparnas with the centre (Louvre) and Montmartre. We had our walks late at night and the area around the hotel seemed very safe. What is more, only 20-30 minutes on foot from the hotel (in an unhurried manner) and you are in front of the Eiffel tour or Palace of Invalide. From our window we could see Montparnasse Tour (10 minutes on foot). Concerning the staff they were rather pleasant and useful. But people who would like to choose this hotel should be ready that it is 2*, furniture is very simple (only TV is modern:, flat and rather big), there is no safe in the room, only on the reception. The bathroom was rather clean but not new. Very often tourists complain on the size of the bathroom. It was not big but enough for the woman of more than middle size:))) I can recommend this hotel who wants to visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: tartanhaggisdog
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband & 2 daughters (10 & 14) for three nights in Sept 2011. We found the location ideal and the staff lovely. The best surprise was the size of our room Having travelled in Europe before I know how small hotel rooms can be but this one was more than satisfactory for the 4 of us. It had 2 single beds and a double bed. Compared the with the budget chain we had most of our accommodation with in the UK, which was usuallya foldout beds beside either side of our queen bed, this room was spacious. We weren't constantly tripping over each other. However, we were here to see Paris not spend time in our room! The ensuite bathroom looked reasonably new and again was spacious and clean. The water pressure on the shower wasn't brilliant but that's not uncommon in Europe. Our room faced into the courtyard so weren't too bothered by noise. As for our Le petit déjeuner we just went to one of the many cafes just outside the hotel door. Would happily stay there again,

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Surprise.”
Reviews.Author: flyinggranny50
Reviews.Content: Being a 2 star hotel we had not expected too much on our recent stay in Paris. We picked the hotel for its location and price. The recent comment that it was too expensive surprises me given that this is Paris. We booked through our travel agent and the breakfast was included. While on that subject I would say that breakfast was better than most I've had in France. There was fresh fruit, cheese, cereal, croissants and rolls, juice, tea and coffee or hot chocolate. Enough to get us started and no one seemed to mind when we made a cheese roll to take for a later snack. The reception staff were exceptionally welcoming, our flight arrived very early and we were at the hotel by 10 am. We were directed to a cafe nearby where we had a coffee and croissant and the room was ready on our return. Better service than we have had at many 4 star hotels. The room was spotlessly clean, yes small but so are all Parisian hotel rooms. My husband, a retired pilot, has stayed in several 5 star hotels in Paris and he commented that the room was no smaller than some of those. The ensuite was modern, large and had a great shower. We were at the back and could just spy the Eiffel Tower which was a bonus. Reception were very helpful with directions, providing a map with the hotel marked. They also pointed out the best and most economical local cafes of which there are many. The reception staff spoke English well and the room staff was very cheerful. The location was perfect, we were going on a river cruise and wanted to be close to the quai, it was about a 10 minute taxi ride. The Pasteur Metro stop is immediately opposite the hotel and you can walk everywhere if so inclined. We are great walkers so tended to use the Metro in the evening to return to the hotel. There are fascinating back streets and markets near the hotel and, as its is in a residential district, you get a real sense of how Parisians live. There were several French families staying at the Innova while we were there and I take that as a good sign of a hotel's value for money. If you are in Paris take the hop on and off boat from the quai below the Eiffel Tower. It is great value and offers a very different way to see Paris. An all day ticket is 12Euro and there are 6 stops. Also, don't miss the Deportation Memorial behind Notre Dame, it is moving and mostly overlooked by tourists. For a cheap and good evening meal go into the Latin Quarter and eat before 7pm, we had a great 3 course meal for 10 Euros! If you plan ahead and take the advise of those who love this city you can 'do' Paris without breaking the bank!

Reviews.Title: “Too much expensive for what it offers!!!”
Reviews.Author: paris_genoa
Reviews.Content: Although the position is definitely great, in the centre of Paris (10 minutes from the Eiffel Tower and 30 step from the metro Pasteur) the price is very high for the poor room (120 € per night). I had a room on the street and it was very very noisy! The bathroom is very small and a bit smelly. Breakfast too expensive to be considered a good idea. Other services are ok (wi-fi connection was very slow) and also the 24h/24 reception is a plus! I would be less satisfied than 2 years ago, when I spent less money there.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Lisa S
Reviews.Content: The staff were the highlight of our stay - so helpful and friendly in arranging our tours and activities. Location was fantastic with metro so easy to use. Our room was very squishy for 4 of us with hardly space for our luggage but we managed and was sufficient for a 2 night stay. Breakfast was worth while and good value. Le Baribar restaurant recommendation from staff was brilliant - excellent food service and value for money. Marina dinner cruise on Seine was worth while. Moulin Rouge was a worthwhile experience but definitely over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small, safe hotel for a solo female traveler.”
Reviews.Author: kolbc1012
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night after flying into Paris. despite its distance from Charles de Gaule it was not hard to find. From CDG just take the blue line to Denfert-Rochereau. There, transfer to metro line 6 towards Charles de Gaule Etoile and get off at Pasteur. That will bring you very near to the hotel! I had to catch a train at gare montparnasse the next morning, which is a 5 minute walk or a short metro ride away. That's why I chose the hotel to begin with. I was pleased- all was as expected. The rooms were small but clean and everything was in working order. I felt safe walking alone around the quartier at 9pm, and though I didn't stay out later I suspect I'd feel unthreatened until midnight or so. The staff was very helpful and welcoming, and also bilingual. The front desk guy set me up with wifi right away- just ask! The hotel has an elevator and a luggage storage room. They provide a 9€ breakfast which I did not get. Also, always try to speak as much French as possible. At the very least oui bonjour and merci! You'll learn and they will appreciate the effort!

Reviews.Title: “good value for short stay”
Reviews.Author: hutchNIreland
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 nights here, a minute to metro stop which takes you across the city. good choice of restaurants in neighbourhood for dinner and breakfast. breakfast in hotel was overpriced..9 euros for coffee, cereal and a few croissants.nice area to walk around at night ,safe. bring earplugs if you find it hard to sleep to the sound of traffic.room was small but perfectly adequate, reception was fine, we are not demanding .

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: kellyabra
Reviews.Content: Great location with the metro right across the street. The room is small but very clean and modern. The front desk very polite and helpful. I recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Kate6794
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel of our stay - the staff was helpful (if you were polite and addressed them in French it helped), the rooms were clean and neat, and we were on the top floor and had a great view of the street life below. Yes, the rooms are slightly outdated, and the walls are thin. We were woken up by our neighbors on a couple of occasions. But it's Europe, and I expect that everywhere, so it wasnt a deal-breaker. Overall we loved this hotel, and the location right by the metro stop was invaluable, since we only had a couple of days in Paris. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: emcangel815
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean, and crews are extremely friendly and accommodating. Location of the hotel is amazing since the Metro is right in front. Not to mention that the bakery and subway restaurant is across the street. Our reservation included a free breakfast, and for what you get, you can't really complain. It does the job of filling your empty stomach. We stayed for 6 nights in which the first 5, our room was on the 6th floor infront. The view from the hotel is amazing, but can be a problem with people with sleeping problem since the noise level can be disturbing to some. For us, it did not matter. THe rooms infront of the hotel has a great view of Mont Parnasse tower, but the Eiffel tower is only visible from the rooms on the back. At no extra cost, they willingly gave us a better room for our last night. OUr last night stayed was a room at the back of the hotel, with AC, view of the beautiful Eiffel tower, and most importantly, quiet room (no road and car noises).

Reviews.Title: “Clean tidy and close to transport”
Reviews.Author: Boemens
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel met all our needs. The bed wcas comfy, the bathroom tiny but new and show pressure was great the rooms are tiny but that is standard in Paris from what we have heard. Te location suited us as we did not want to be in th tourist area and we were close to transit to get quickly to where ever we wanted. Supermarket two street away and carrefour the other direction found a very good japanese place and generally had a great stay. Only thing that would have added to the stay was a mini fridge for the wine and cheese!

Reviews.Title: “Very cosy place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sc0rpius
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris 5 days and we enjoyed the stay due to the good services and conditions in this hotel. Very good location, easy to get whenever you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great value,location and staff...”
Reviews.Author: BarronB
Reviews.Content: Based on other reviews, we stayed here for a week as part of our 40th Anniversary trip. The 51 room hotel is 50 yards from the Metro Pastuer on a fairly busy Boulevard.. Although the rooms are indeed small compared to Canadian hotel bedrooms, we found ours to be very clean, nicely furnished and the beds(two singles pushed together)extremely comfortable. Extra pillows were available in the room. No drawer space, but an adequate wardrobe with 12 hangers!!, and unit with 2 wide shelves. Free WiFi access worked well,Flat screen TV, with English(BBC and CNN) news. Bathroom with shower small but very clean and new fixtures..Excellent water pressure in the shower. Remember this hotel is on a thoroughfare with traffic. There will be some noise, but we were on the 6th floor and the new windows muffled most of the sound. Rather neat to hear the sounds of the city We had excellent A/C in our room... check on booking.Telephone and desk with chair in room. Reception desk staff quietly friendly and helpful even though our french is poor. We were able to get to Versailles,the Louvre, Orsay,Cluny,Arc de Triumph, Sacre Coeur,etc easily using the Metro. Remember to buy your tickets in a "carnet"(10 tickets) for EU12.70. We walked to Napoleons tomb and Les Invalides museum in about 25 minutes. The Eiffel tower took quite a bit longer, but is do-able. Very near Gare Montparnasse which is a very large station...about 15-20 minutes downhill to hotel . (Make sure you go up the Montparnasse Tower...views are amazing...better than the Eiffel Tower. Not as long lines and cheaper!!) Bus to Gare du Nord across the road near Cafe Pasteur. We dined here once, whIch catered to the younger local crowd, Food and service good .La Salle a Manger (3 doors down from the hotel) had a reasonable fixed price menu (EU17.20 at time of writing) for 2 courses. we ate here 3 times ...all good! Especially the lamb shanks1 We booked online and got a good deal and excellent email service. Great if you want a comfy bed with few frills, and a location a little out of the maddening crowds but still within easy reach of all Paris has to offer..Overall, very good value for money . We ewill most certainly use the Innova again,

Reviews.Title: “Just Decent”
Reviews.Author: Armchairshrink27
Reviews.Content: This is a very basic two-star hotel in a pretty good location for the price. It's right next to a Metro stop in a non-touristy neighborhood, with some great little cafes and bars, as well as a supermarket all within a block or two. The room itself was small, but that's typical in Europe, particularly at this price range. There is no A/C, which is only a problem when it's hot, but it was very hot when we visited. This is true of most hotels in Paris, though, so it's not a complaint specifically against this hotel. It was clean enough but not sparkling, the bed was fine, the service wasn't particularly welcoming but I didn't expect that either. Not an amazing find, but if you get a good price for it, it's a decent home base in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what I was looking for - clean and good location!”
Reviews.Author: KateKessler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Innova was perfect for what I was looking for. I was traveling by myself, but didn't have any intention of staying in my hotel room a lot. The room as very clean, free wifi, and the subway stop was right across the street. There was a little street noise/construction, but it wasn't anything too bad. I will definitely be back, and I would recommend Hotel Innova to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Room was bit small but clean and cozy”
Reviews.Author: Spatulaman
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a room with a double bed on the 6th floor. The room size was "double bed + walking space around it". It also came with a good sized bathroom with a bathtub. Both common space and room were clean. They offer wireless network but was bit weak in the room we stayed. We will be happy to return to this hotel for the price we payed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripgirl31
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 14 nights and thought it was excellent. Since we were staying for so many nights, they put us in a corner room facing the courtyard, therefore it was really quiet. We had requested an air conditioned room and a room above the 1st floor and they honored our request. That always makes me happy. Yes, the rooms are smaller, but most European hotels are smaller, so we were not expecting a massive room. The bed was very comfortable which is a plus in my eyes and they kept our room nice and tidy. The people at the front desk were very friendly and helpful and would be more than happy to make arrangements for you if need be. We also thought the location was excellent. A nice walk to some of the popular destinations and close to the metro. It was also close to some great cafes and restaurants. There is a small boulangerie right across the street which is to die for and a really good restaurant, called L'Epicuriste. I felt very safe and comfortable in this hotel. I would definitely come recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “My third stay at Hotel Innova”
Reviews.Author: MHKtraveller
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Hotel Innova, dating back to 1997 when they still had the old lift that stopped half way between the floors! Alas, times have changed and the past two times (2009, 2011) I have stayed there has been a new lift and refurbished rooms as well. The major positives of this hotel for me are: 1) location is right next to Pasteur metro and Montparnasse train station, and via No 6 metro line is also just a few stops from Denfert-Rochereau station to catch RER to CDG, and 2) the front desk staff are extremely helpful and friendly (without exception) and many have been at hotel for as long as I have visited. The rooms are clean and starting to show some age since like redo but the hotel is still very good value for the money. I stayed this past time with two other people (I had double room, they had singles) and their comments were similar to mine.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced, airless and noisy.”
Reviews.Author: bid79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Innova two years ago in winter and had a great stay. It is conveniently located, has a good breakfast and the rooms are a reasonable size (for what you pay). We returned recently and were very disappointed. The prices have gone up; breakfast is now extra but the biggest problems we had was the lack of fresh air. The rooms have no air conditioning or fans and the because the rooms are small they get very stuffy very quickly. If the windows are open it is extremely noisy (acknowledging there will always be street noise through the night when you stay in a big city). One of the nights we stayed, the bar on the corner had a band playing on the street from 1am to 3:45am – I doubt any of the guests got any sleep that night. I would recommend Innova for a winter stay if you get a good deal. But in warmer weather, I recommend you spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattCoach
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on a solo trip to Paris. The room was small but perfect. I was on the 6th floor with a great view of the city and Montparnasse Tower. Oh, and the shower in this room was fantastic - very high pressure which is always nice after a long day of walking and exploring! The location of the hotel is perfect as its just a few steps from the Metro station - Pasteur - for lines 6 and 12. Just a short jaunt to the Eiffel and to the Arc D' Triumph, or really any connecting line to wherever you want to go in the great city of Paris. The Hotel staff was very friendly, spoke English for the most part and would even engage in some Franglish conversations with me. Great little hotel, would easily stay here again on a trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We heartily recommend this hotel to any of our friends going to Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Monica94601
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Innova for 3 nights. We found it clean and comfortable, with extremely friendly and helpful staff, as everyone else has said. The location across from the Pasteur Metro stop can't be beat. Take advantage of that, especially if you're arriving with suitcases. Switch Metro lines if you must to arrive at Pasteur rather than walk from Gare Montparnasse. We didn't and we were sorry. I strongly dispute the characterization of a "five minute walk"! The only negative - as many have also said - is the noise from the street. It was pretty warm and we had to leave the window open to stay cool. Even though we were on the 5th floor, it seemed like we heard traffic noise all night. On the other hand, we got used to it pretty quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Restful and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: VivienTO
Reviews.Content: Basic yet clean room amenities. Helpful and friendly staff. Metro is across the hotel. Gare Montparnasse (where you alight from the Air France Bus or train) is a station away on Line 6 towards Charles de Gaulle Etoile station (fewer stairs to negotiate). I enjoyed being roused by the smell of fresh bread in the morning in this hotel. There was this great bakery (boulangerie) though on the other side of the street beside the flower shop and Subway.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: thefamilythattravels
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel had an excellent location for the price: the neighborhood was nice (we felt very safe) and there was a metro station right across the street. There was a market/garage sale Sunday that was a pleasant surprise and unique, unexpected addition to our stay in Paris. Our triple room was small, however, the view of the eiffel tower from our window and balcony made up for it. Breakfast was not included; there were cafes nearby, but not many restaurants for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “A very good and safe location”
Reviews.Author: Starlander
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there for 3 night. I am very satisfied with the hotel room and services. The room was clean. Moreover, it is just next to the metropolitan station so even you are walking alone back to the hotel at night you feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: larry_downy
Reviews.Content: We were on holidays in Paris and stayed in 3 different hotels. All of them were very nice. This one I liked very much, as it is very close to the Metro (Pasteur Station) - you just need to cross the road. The view from the window was good (we lived on the last - 7th floor) The room was small, but this as I found is normal for hotels in Paris. The hotel is situated not far from the centre - about 15-20 minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower. We had free wi-fi in the room. Can not say anything about food as we didn't have breakfast. The price was very good!

Reviews.Title: “All that I needed and a little more!”
Reviews.Author: coachcritty
Reviews.Content: Hotel Innova and its staff was excellent! The rooms, while small (you are in Paris), were very clean and provided exactly the accommodations described. The beds were comfortable and the room was serviced daily. The bathroom was small, but the shower was EXCELLENT!! The water was hot and the pressure was amazing...just what you want after 13 hours of traveling or a long day of sight-seeing. The bonuses about the hotel- 1. A rock star view of the Eiffel Tower 2. Proximity to the metro 3. Amazing bakery across the street!! PS--There is a shuttle that the hotel contracts with to and from the airport that I didn't find mentioned on either sight.

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality-price rapport. Cordiality. Good position. Wi-fi free.”
Reviews.Author: paris_genoa
Reviews.Content: As I write in the title everything ok. very good hotel. not too expensive. cheaper than others in Paris. In centre. 5 minutes from montparnasse. 1 minute from the metro station (pasteur). Wi fi connection free and good. Clean. Just a little bit of noise due to the boulevard. Simple and small room and wc, but it isn't a problem if you just want to stay there for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - better than most 3 stars in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: musictravelgirl
Reviews.Content: I was immediately impressed by how spotlessley clean the hotel rooms and bathrooms were. For a 2 star hotel it is friendly, spacious and clean. We stayed over the New Year and on NYE they left us fine chocolates with a personal message which was a nice touch. Rooms were cleaned by the time we got back in afternoons. The staff are very nice and helpful. I would reccomend this to anyone going to Paris and not wanting to spend massive amounts on a hotel. I have stayed in a 3 star in the very center before and it was AWFUL in comparison. The hotel is right next to Pasteur metro station which gets you everywhere else! It's a bit of a long walk to the Eiffel Tower, but I imagine in summer it is nicer. We still walked :) We stayed here on a deal with eurostar, and if you're coming on Eurostar it is very easy to get to hotel via metro using their website directions. Oh and also I requested views of the Eiffel Tower and we got 2 rooms with views. Was lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Clean is good,”
Reviews.Author: kafkaesque
Reviews.Content: all staff very pleasant and helpful, but room was small, and shower must have been designed for very skinny people (if I moved in the shower, I'd flip the faucet and the water would turn off.) And very noisy. I live in a second floor apt on a busy NYC street and I can attest that our noise is nothing compared to Paris. So many loud motor bikes at all hours of the night. Otherwise, I concur with a previous reviewer. As a female traveling alone, I felt safe and liked being near a Metro station, even if it wasn't a Metro station that was particularly useful for me, but I was thoroughly bored with the neighborhood. No atmosphere, nothing opened in the evenings, nothing to look at at all, not even stores of interest to browse. I have no doubt I would have enjoyed my five nights in Paris if I'd been in another part of the city where there was more activity.

Reviews.Title: “wake up with smell of freshly baked bread (at 6 am)”
Reviews.Author: Jordanella
Reviews.Content: Location is pretty good because it's close to the metro, not because of the surroundings. Rooms are small, pretty clean but also a bit noisy. And I woke up every day at 6 am because of the smell of baked bread and had to open my window to get some fresh air in. I was in room 70, 7th floor, just above the stairwell, so don't know if other guests had the same (luxury) problem..... People at desk are very friendly and at checkout you can store your luggage in an area behind the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic... but a word for solo travellers”
Reviews.Author: queensgal29
Reviews.Content: Hello, I stayed at the Hotel Innova for three nights recently, after reading the recommendations on Trip Advisor. I was looking for a hotel that wasn't swanky, was reasonably priced, clean and comfortable, without the trimmings. While I can recommend Hotel Innova as a (mostly) suitable place, two major issues stood out for me as a female solo traveller, which made my stay not particularly enjoyable that I thought I'd share: * Noise: when booking, request a room at the back of the hotel. I had hardly any sleep for two nights out of three due to traffic noise and pedestrians. I am a moderately light sleeper admittedly, but it was a very noisy road, and it drove me a tad nuts, even with the window sealed shut. Also, if booking one of the single rooms, try to NOT get Rooms 14 or 15 - ie: rooms on the first floor, right next to the elevator, hotel office and breakfast room. This means that from 7am onwards you will be awake listening to every single guest dining walking past your room, the lift repeatedly opening, hotel office staff talking outside in the corridor etc. Add to that the fact that on two days they were doing renovations (driling, hammering, all without notice?) above my room... needless to say there was no sleep in's at all. So the big lesson is: get a a room not on the first floor, and one at the back! * Location: yes, the Metro is right across from the hotel which makes is super easy for travel. But, what people here didn't mention (or maybe no one else felt it?) is that Blvd Pasteur/Montparnasse itself is rather... atmosphere-less. I felt like I was out of the action somewhat. As a solo traveller, after three days of walking around and hanging out with pals I realised I would have loved being in the buzz of somewhere like St Michel, St Germain, or the ambience of Île Saint-Louis. Montmartre, even. My Parisian friends all thought Montparnasse was out of the action. I found wandering the streets at 10pm looking for food eerily quiet after the buzz of the Latin Quarter. So all in all, not a bad hotel but for those travelling alone, I'd think about location more carefully. And bring earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, free WiFi, Good Room and staff”
Reviews.Author: ricexmm
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night at hotel innova and everything was great. I highly recommend this place based on the following: 1) great M6 Pasteur stop Metro location 2) helpful, friendly staff 3) 25 euro shuttle offered to return to Charles De Gaule 4) free WiFi 5) free fax receive 6) comfortable rooms 7) great location

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ronald_adam
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night in this hotel but will book it again for sure when visiting Paris in the future. The room was basic and clean but the location is perfect. Metro station across the street and only 10 minutes from the Eiffel Tower. Don't expect luxury but you'll probably won't be in the room that much. Staff is very helpfull!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Innova: a well-located gem”
Reviews.Author: h_d_keogh
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Hotel Innova in early August. The hotel is extremely close to Pasteur Metro stop on lines six and twelve, though it is a bit of a journey from the Gard Du Nord (if arriving by Eurostar) – allow forty five minutes, changing from the RER at Denfer-Rochereau. The hotel appears to have been refurbished recently and is spotless throughout. All three front-of-house staff with whom we dealt were helpful and patient with our less-than-flawless French. The rooms are not big but neither are they conspicuously small by Parisian standards in this price range and the bed was comfortable. The en-suite shower room was again compact but perfectly useable with abundant shower pressure. One point to bear in mind: not all rooms in the hotel are air-conditioned and initially we were given a non-AC room on the fourth floor of the hotel facing Boulevard Pasteur. It was too warm to sleep without an open window but it is a busy road throughout the night and very noisy, consequently we asked to move to an air-conditioned room. We were given a sixth floor room on the rear of the hotel with a super view of the Eiffel Tower (about two thirds of it!) and it made a huge difference. I would struggle to recommend staying in a non-AC room during warm weather. Breakfast was delicious and excellent value (9 Euros). The hotel is very well located for left-bank sights, for example Les Invalides and the Eiffel Tower (each approx twenty minute walk), St Germain, Le Jardin De Luxembourg etc. Nearby Montparnasse has a great selection of restaurants, particularly Breton creperies. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Innova and would definitely return; it compares favourably with more expensive 3* Parisian hotels in my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, comfortable and coffee in the square”
Reviews.Author: BobbyMilk
Reviews.Content: We used TripAdvisor to book Hotel Innova last year and we were more than pleased. First and foremost; we were welcomed in from the rain by a lovely man working at the reception desk and given the keys to our room. From the room's small balcony you could see the Pasteur metro station. It's literally seconds away from the hotel - for us this was invaluable. The room was clean, well furnished and not too small. We stayed here for six nights in August 2009 and enjoyed it so much that we have decided to stay there again for New Year's Eve 2010. The hotel is a real find and offers real value for money. It also has Internet access in the lobby. The hotel is within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and Les Hotel Invalides. Just across the street from the hotel is the wonderful Cafe Pasteur which offers plenty of wines, beers and wonderful food. Make sure to get the seat up against the wall at the front of the building as you can see the Eiffel Tower. Also on the other side of the street is a bakery, SubWay (it does great coffee), a chemist and other restaurants. If you're visiting Paris and can't afford the more expensive hotels I thoroughly recommend that you give Hotel Innova, and hopefully like us, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location, good room”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireChaula
Reviews.Content: You hear so much about bad Paris hotels that we were pretty worried that we wouldn't find anywhere decent. But we were really happy with this. Hardly what you'd call cheap but certainly at the cheaper end in Paris. Great location - it's a minute from the Metro (Pasteur) and that's only 4 stops to the Eiffel Tower - and handy for other place too. It's about half hour walk to Eiffel Tower. Breakfast wasn't included - it was the usual rip-off and didn't look great so we just went somewhere local. The staff were really friendly and great with our son. The room was nice - obviously recently decorated. The bonus was a fantastic view of the Eiffel Tower. But don't book the hotel just on that - we were just lucky - I reckon only two or three rooms have the view - luckily ours did.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with good price”
Reviews.Author: Chloebebe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, room was in OK size. But bathroom was small, no air condition in our room so we had our window open even at night that we could hear all the noises from the street. But overall i would say this was a great hotel to stay in Paris with good price and good location. Metro station and mini-mart were just right across the street from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent! great hotel, fantastic breakfast, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: andreab2810
Reviews.Content: travelled with husband and 7 year old daughter. comfy beds,friendly, clean and an excellent breakfast for 9 euro. located within walkin distance to tower etc. across the road from pasteur metro. dont hesitate to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money - is this really a ** star hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Sandra17101969
Reviews.Content: We found that Innova has really a great value for money. First of all, the hotel is really spotlessly clean and the beds are great. Important for any hotel. Furthermore the staff is superfriendly, courteous, and helpful. We were not satisfied with our 1.40m bed for two persons. Without hesitation they gave us another room with a huge bathroom. Good service. Some small minuspoints were that indeed you can hear the noise of your neigbours and that the breakfast was somewhat stale. But one the whole you would think that Innova would be a ***hotel! Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Stop searching!”
Reviews.Author: -Man0nTheMove-
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel due to a recommendation from my parents, which stayed there about 10 years ago. The Hotel has got renewed since then and you get a really small (you are in Paris!) but clean and quiet room in very good location. We even could see the top of the Eiffel Tower from our window! The only thing what me missed was a fridge, but we knew in advance that there isn`t one. If you look for a simple, clean and quiet room for a reasonable price (for Paris) i can recommend you the Innova!

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls, but otherwise great”
Reviews.Author: badeendje
Reviews.Content: Service was good, and the hotel staff’s English was adequate. The hotel foyer, breakfast room and other public spaces generally looked well kept. The hotel is nicely situated almost on top of the Pasteur metro station (lines 6 and 12), which offers a superb connection to other parts of the city. I stayed in a single room which would have been big enough for two people. There was a nice television (although everything was in French except for a few German channels and an English CNN) and my hotel room offered a view of the top section of the Eiffel Tower. The bathroom was small but large enough, and the shower was strong & hot. The room was very clean – I found no dust or questionable spots anywhere – except for a few moldy patches in the shower cubicle. My room was situated at the back of the hotel where there were almost no traffic noises, but as the walls were very thin there were quite some noises from neighboring rooms. If you are a light sleeper, prepare for the possibility of being kept awake by people speaking at normal conversational level, the sounds of a television, doors opening/closing and toilets flushing. However, if you are not as easily disturbed or plan a full day of sight-seeing in Paris which is sure to leave you exhausted, I found the quality of the bed to be comfortable. Breakfast consisted of a tray with some breads, coffee/tea/chocolate and a separate small buffet of fruits, yoghurt, fruit juices and the likes. I suspect one could get more bread than what is served by default, but as the basics were enough for me I cannot be sure. A nice touch is that you do not have to decide on taking breakfast until you actually enter the breakfast room, and that you can have your breakfast delivered to your room at no additional cost. Strong points: location, cleanliness, hotel staff and room size. Weak point: thin walls.

Reviews.Title: “Best of stayed in in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mazabc
Reviews.Content: Just got bac extremely clean excellant location. Few steps from pastuer metro. Clear view of Eiffel tower from outside hotel. 5 mins from montpernasse. Loads if cafes and restaurants around. With a nicer breakfast would b perfect but that was just me out of 4

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: mangoesandcherries
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights & found the room to be small but adequate. Our room had a double & two single beds, a large cupboard which we used to store all our bags in & two wall heaters, one by the window & a large one in the bathroom, so the room was very warm & cosy.The bathroom was spotlessly clean & the beds very comfortable. The staff were friendly & helpful, so overall we enjoyed our stay here & would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Brunoe1124
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris for 10 day to attend a tradeshow and before the event I had some personal days in Paris. Since I was going to pay for the room myself, I wanted to make sure that I had a great room in a good location. Based on the comments on tripadvisor, I decided to go to Hotel Innova. I was really pleased with my stay. The people at the front desk were polite, as were the housekeepers and the ladies in charge of breakfast. (I willingly paid the money because I wanted to do some sight seeing when I left the hotel immediately.) The hotel is right next to the Pasteur metro and you can reach all of the tourists sites within minutes. Safety wise there was always someone at the desk and the doors were locked after midnight. You had to ring a bell to get let in which I found assuring since they saw who was coming in and out of the building. The one thing I did not like was that I couldn't access the internet from my room and I had to do it in the foyer, as did the other tourists in the hotel. For my first trip to Paris I felt that I made the right decision to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel - so glad we found it”
Reviews.Author: RevGeoff52
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with the Innova. Our room was great, not huge but not tiny and with good decor and furnishing. We were pleased that the room was at the back of the hotel as there was no traffic noise at all. We even had a view of the upper section of the Eiffel Tower which was lovely at night. (That was a bonus - most rooms faced a different direction.) The en suite shower room was small but adequate and with a superb shower and lovely new tiling. The new flat screen TV had an integrated DVD - if we'd known that then we'd have taken some DVDs to watch as the only English channels we could find on the satellite TV were CNN and Eurosport! But maybe we just didn't master the complicated remote. The location is excellent. The Pasteur Metro station is right outside the door in a wide tree-lined avenue. But we walked to most places - 20 minutes to the Champs de Mars, and then a 10 minute stroll to the Eiffel Towel. About 30 minutes walk also to Ile de la Cite (via Jardin du Luxembourg). The reception desk staff were all friendly, helpful and English speaking. And the breakfast buffet was great. A simple but good selection - cereals, juice, fruit salad, various breads and buns, jams, yoghurt etc - and we could eat as much as we wanted. That set us up well for the day and we only needed snack-bars and fruit for so that was a real saving. (We were on a tight budget so were also glad to find a relatively inexpensive Chinese restaurant round the corner where we ate each evening.) The only downside ended up as a big plus. I'd carefully booked a hotel on the Eurostar Planet (Expedia) webpage which had "breakfast included" but on arrival we were told that this was definitely not the case. I had a print out from the Eurostar webpage saying 'breakfast included' (I'd half-suspected it might not be as the booking confirmation didn't mention it and the price was very reasonable) but the desk-clerk insisted that this was Eurostar's mistake, not theirs. I accepted this without making too much fuss and we resigned ourselves to having to pay out for breakfast and take it up with Eurostar on our return. But when we got back to the hotel on the first evening the manager had decided to honour Eurostar's details (which had by then been corrected on the webpage). That was a grand and welcome gesture, and typical of the cheerful helpfulness that we found throughout our 3 night stay. If I go to Paris again I won't even bother to look at other hotels - I'll head straight back to the Innova. Even with breakfast to pay for it will still be excellent value for money and an ideal place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Great Location but Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: westvillagechic
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and is clean. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. However, the walls to our room were very thin that you can hear your neighbors going in and out of their rooms (I would say this was the only negative aspect of the hotel). There is free wi-fi in the lobby. The towels in the room are like gym towels - maybe a little more rougher. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Traveler's hotel - wouldn't pay more than $100 USD”
Reviews.Author: ike301
Reviews.Content: I paid about $104 USD (69 Euro) with taxes. Got a 7th floor room. Room was small but enough. Bathroom was pretty small. Towels were like the ones they give you at the gym - rough and overwashed-looking. The lobby and elevator look nice, but the room decor was serviceable. I wouldn't say I'd stay and chill in the room or hotel. The Wi-Fi is only in the lobby area. And the connection SUCKED. You are not able to access the Wi-Fi in your room. And if you don't have a computer, you gotta pay with the one they have in the lobby. I will say that the Pastuer metro is just down the block which is nice. Just a hop and a skil walk to Mont-passe. Also about 5 blocks from the Air France Shuttle bus stop. Bottom line - we had to come back to Paris for a one night stay and didn't want to spend a lot of money. This is a great place to just have as a home base while you explore the city. I say we spent about 1 hour washing up, 6 hours of sleep, and that was about it. There was no safe in the room, which sucked. The guys at the desk didn't speak a lot of English. I wouldn't say they weren't friendly, but they definitely were not active in service. 60-70 Euros at MOST I would pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideGraeme
Reviews.Content: I found the Hotel Innova clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and could speak english. Internet access using inhouse computer in foyer was good (purchase a card with access code first) or could use wireless. Very close to Pasteur Subway which was very convenient after a day of wandering the city. It didnt have every amenity, but had just what I needed for overnight accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with friendly knowledgeable staff”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTravelbug123
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located - just across the street from Pasteur subway station. Rooms were small, quiet, and clean. Free internet is available in the lobby if you bring your own computer. Where this hotel really excels is with its friendly and knowledgeable staff. Staff went above and beyond helping us to book taxis/shuttle buses to and from airport. Staff were very knowledgeable about the surrounding areas. Will definitely stay here again when we return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: nnneeesss
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Innova in March 09, comfortable enough stay. Pros: Clean, quiet, comfortable, good wifi connection, has an elevator (although tiny), friendly daytime staff, nice safe residential area, right next to metro Pasteur, about a 15 minute walk to the Invalides. Clean bathroom...something i'm very fussy about!!! Let me check in early, breakfast ladies were always cheerful/happy to help :) Cons: Tiny rooms (to be expected from paris i guess) and tiny tiny bathroom, walls kinda thin (was woken on one occasion by neighbours' nocturnal activities, but otherwise slept well throughout my stay), construction work was going on on the facade of the hotel the time that i was there so was woken on weekday mornings by voices of the workers outside my window, but i didn't mind too much, and i wonder if the construction's finished now, residential area so not too much by way of activities around the hotel-would be more suitable for family oriented people, but it suited my purposes just fine Comfortable enough stay..perhaps a little pricey though....next time i'd probably stay something cheaper/ a more lively area like the marais/latin quarter/oberkampf/bastille area for nightlife/character...but wouldn't complain if i stayed at innova again :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, small rooms, ok service, I would recommend”
Reviews.Author: dsbc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Innova from June 29th-July 4th 2009. Location: The hotel is is close to the metro station and easy to find. The location was in a nice, safe area with restaurants, pharmacies, grocery store near by. The G20 supermarket was right down the road. It took about 30+ minutes to get to most attractions. We usually walked home at night or took the metro for 1.60 euros (one way). Service: Depending on who you got at the front desk the service was from bad to fairly good. One of the front desk workers was not overly helpful or accommodating but others were willing to answer all your questions. We did have better service at other places we stayed along our trip. The woman who works in the breakfast area was great! Continental breakfast: Good breakfast...again not the best but it set us up nicely for the day. Pastries, breads, cheese, cereal, juice, coffee (the best coffee of our trip), fruit salad. Rooms: The room was small, clean, newer with two twin beds and a balcony. Having the small balcony made the room feel bigger. They had a flat screen t.v with a good selection of channels. The bathroom was small with a shower (no bathtub) and was always clean. No complaints about the room, but it was small. Overall nice little hotel for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: mothersap
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a triple for three nights. I can't rate this hotel any better than average for a few reasons. The triple room had three single beds and we could barely walk between them. I know Paris hotel rooms are small, but this was ridiculous. The beds and linens themselves were terrible. Walls were in serious need of a coat of paint. What bothered me the most was though was the following. The front desk keeps the key to your room when you leave for the day. When we returned the first night, the desk clerk was the same person who checked us in so that was not a problem. However, on the 2nd and 3rd night the desk clerk was two different people who neither knew us nor we knew him. When we asked for the room key it was given to us with no questions asked. After it happened the first time we advised management the next day, but clearly nothing was said to staff because it happened again. It quite scary to think that any stranger could walk into the hotel and ask for room number xxx and be given the key, no questions asked. Training of the front desk staff is clearly needed. The pluses are those previously mentioned. Quiet neighborhood. The metro stop is right out the front door and there are bakeries within a short walk. We also had a great view of the Eiffel Tower from our 4th floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, decent room and service”
Reviews.Author: MitchellBeth
Reviews.Content: Firstly, it has to be said that the location of the hotel is wonderful. Located in a quiet square that is just busy enough to be interesting but not too overwhelming, you step out the hotel and there are plenty of friendly bakeries, supermarkets, cafes, and a pharmacy. There is also a Metro station metres away from the entrance. In terms of sightseeing, depending on what floor you are located on, a view of the Sacre Coeur is probable, and the Eiffel Tower is approximately only 4 stops from the Pastuer Metro station. The staff speak very good English and are very welcoming, helpful, assisting and friendly. They also offer a serivce that lets you drop off your luggage before you check in or keep it there after you check out. The hotel itself is extremely clean and tidy, with a very modern lobby area and decent sized rooms complete with a clean bathroom. Facilities such as fax and internet access are available for a small fee. Most importantly, the bed was a great size! Overall I would whole heartadly recommend this hotel to people visiting Paris who want somewhere quiet and friendly to retreat after a long day's sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Babydeey
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for our honeymoon and we spent a wonderful week at the Innova Hotel. The location is great. The metro stop PASTEUR is in front of the hotel and from here you can travel all over Paris so easily with line 6 or 9. The room was very small but clean, and with a great bed. The bathroom was tiny too. I personally disliked the breakfast, which was the same every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & still travel in comfort”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Traveller_AU
Reviews.Content: We spent a long time researching hotels in Paris to find a nice hotel within our budget & were very pleased with our choice. The hotel is in a great location. Easy accessible by train from the airport and only a 15 minuate walk to the Eiffel Tower (nice walk past bakeries, markets & Napolean burial site). Also close to Luxemburg gardens & supermarkets too. We were pleased with the professional staff & clean rooms. Rooms are small (but they all seam to be that way in Paris). Would definately recomend this boutique hotel to those on a budget but still wanting to traveling in comfort,

Reviews.Title: “quaint gem”
Reviews.Author: louisetoronto
Reviews.Content: great little hotel very close to pasteur subway station which has both the #6 & #12 lines so very convenient. breakfast included was very nice - in a quaint little breakfast room the breakfast ladies were very nice, & accomodating - they even made up a tray 2x for me to bring to my room for my daughter!! One of the guys at the front desk was very helpful with directions & tips - he even told us about the free entry to the Louvre last Sat. night!! The only thing I would have liked to have in our room was a little kettle to boil water for a cup of tea!!! Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location . . .”
Reviews.Author: JeffMurrell
Reviews.Content: Very nice little hotel tucked away inconspicuously about a ten-minute walk from the tallest skyscraper in France, the 59-story Tour Montparnasse which dramatically faces off from across the city against the famous Eiffel Tower which sparkles at night with specialty illumination on the hour, every hour after dark. Just minutes away from the Gare Montparnasse (main railroad station in Paris), the hotel is just a few minutes’ walk away from renting a car to tour Normandy or catching the train to Versailles. The room we had was quite clean but quite small indeed – barely enough room for me and my wife to maneuver around in, but comfortable, nonetheless, with adequate seating, but no coffee maker or mini-bar/fridge. Also no ice machines, though the staff was happy to bring us “une petite tourine de glacons” (a little bowl of ice cubes) upon request. A very handy Metro stop is located just across the street which will take you right to the Eiffel-Tower Metro station (Bir-Hakeim #6 Metro line) and also straight to charming Montmartre (Pigalle #12 Metro line). Breakfast in the morning is at additional cost, but well worth it. Free WiFi in the spacious lobby was very much appreciated, but the location of the hotel is its strong point. No air conditioning that we could find, but comfy enough at night with the balcony doors thrown open (provided there’s a breeze in the summer). Lots of dependable hot water in the tiny, but adequate and stylish bathroom! The street on which the hotel is located (Pasteur) is quiet most of the time, but subject to the loud cries, laughs and articulated buffoonery of roving, partying juveniles on weekends. No views, really, from the balcony (see photo), but interesting, nonetheless. Very friendly and helpful staff, quite knowledgeable about the city. Warning: You should have a basic, working knowledge of the French language in order to be able to fully communicate with them, though some at the front desk speak English well enough. I would give it 2½ stars in all.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: topkapitan
Reviews.Content: In Paris for two days of leisure late April 2009. Although working in hospitality, I only have compliments for Hotel Innova. Clean, neat and well located across Pasteur Metro station. Free Wifi as well. Walking distance from Luxembourg gardens, Eiffel Tower and other great sites and with 3 french bakeries within 200 meters. Pleasant personnel and no fuss. Basically good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean”
Reviews.Author: LCaraway
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my first trip to Paris. I found the staff and cleanliness to be great. Some downsides are the hotel is quite a bit away from all the attractions in Paris, although as others said you are literally steps away from a metro station. Was a little disappointed the wifi didn't work on my laptop, and that I had to pay for internet for some business related purposes I had to take care of. Overall, once I learned how to take advantage of the metro I found the hotel to be good. Walking around the area late at night I felt safe, but again it is out of the touristy areas which is a good and bad thing.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved Hotel Innova”
Reviews.Author: ekeat
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at Hotel Innova for three nights last week. I cannot recommend this hotel ENOUGH. We had a fabulous stay and I must thank all the reviews on trip advisor for helping me find this wonderful hotel. We had a twin double room. The room and bathroom were small (as can only be expected for Paris, trust me) but impeccably clean, newly renovated, and nicely decorated. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was up to American standards. This hotel is a true "find" because it is newly renovated and clean but still feels Parisian. The elevator worked fine and was much larger than many elevators in Paris(held a few people and their luggage). I booked it through a web deal and paid 100 euros per night. The staff were very friendly. They are bilingual but kindly spoke French with us to help us practice our french skills. One gentleman was very helpful when we needed to organize our airport transport. He took time with us and explained the different options ( we chose the shuttle which takes 1 hour and costs 12 euros per person to Charles de Gaulle). We didn't have any problems with noise in our room. In fact, the hotel was very quiet. The only downside to our room was that the hotel had scaffolding across the entire front of it so our view and balcony were blocked. Hotel Innova is in the 15th arrondissement. It's one block away from the Pasteur metro stop (easy access to many popular parts of the city: Latin Quarter, Madeleine/Opera area, Champs Elysee, Montmartre). Montparnasse ( a very busy and fun area) is a 5-10 minute walk away. The Seine is a 15-20 minute walk north. The Luxembourg Gardens are also a 20 minute walk. This location isn't as touristy as others, but it is very safe and also has a nice Parisian residential feel to it that other areas lose due to tourists. Hotel Innova may not be directly near any major monuments/museums BUT it is located near metros that make is extremely convenient to get to any and all of those attractions. I will definitely stay at Innova on my next trip to Paris. Don't miss out on an amazing restaurant around the corner, Le Dix Vins on Rue Falguiere. It was 24 euros per person for a three course, fabulous meal with great service and an extensive wine list.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, free wifi, nice area”
Reviews.Author: krazee1000
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were bilingual and helpful. Free wifi in lobby, however the connection was intermittant. A few steps from Pasteur metro station, making travel very convenient. Only a few minutes to a couple of local supermarkets for shopping. Room was clean and comfortable. Elevator was slow. A hidden gem and excellent value for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: nymph2106
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the wonderful reviews on Trip Advisor and did not regret it at all. First of all, I have to say Hotel Innova deserves way more than its two-star rating. It's more like a good three-star hotel, judging from my recent experience there. I stayed three nights, paying about 83 euros a night. It's not exactly a budget rate, but I wanted a place with decent reviews and in a safe area as I was a female traveller in Paris alone. I had requested for a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower but the hotel manager told me when I checked in that all their rooms with a view of the tower were occupied, and he was very apologetic about it. He gave me a corner room on the second floor which was huge and probably amazing value, since I had paid the rate for a single room. It had a double bed and TWO single beds and could probably take up to four people. The room was clean and neat, as was the bathroom, which had a bath-tub. For a two-star hotel, the attention paid to little details in the room was much appreciated. There were plenty of clean towels (changed every day), basic toiletries like soap and shampoo, and extra pillows and blankets in the wardrobe, which also came with many hangers. Both the room and bathroom had a heater, which kept me warm and comfortable in the winter nights in Paris. The reception had someone around the clock, so safety wasn't really an issue, and the staff were always friendly and helpful when it came to recommendations on places to see in the area. They also spoke good English. The hotel lift was out of order when I arrived, and the hotel manager offered to help me with my heavy luggage without me asking. The next day, the lift was up and working again. The hotel is just right opposite the entrance to Pasteur metro station, which makes exploring Paris very convenient. I would return to the hotel late at night, sometimes after 11pm, and the area felt safe and was well-lit. Right next door to the hotel is a nice cafe, Relais Le Montparnasse, which does a small breakfast set for 5.50 euros in the morning. The staff there speak basic English so no problems when it comes to ordering. Across the street, there is a pharmacy if you need to get anything. The only quibble I can find with this hotel is that the floors and walls are a bit thin, and you can often hear the occupant of the room above you moving around. It can also be a bit noisy when people return to their rooms late at night. I'm not a light sleeper though, so this didn't bother me too much.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice, stayed twice”
Reviews.Author: dezer
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed & both times have been nice, clean value for money. Staff are quite friendly & reliable & make you feel welcome. Our room near the lift was a little noisy but OK. Beautiful balcony onto the street was lovely but sometimes a little noisy but to be expected. Location was excelent & would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: mellecho
Reviews.Content: The Innova is a good place to stay in Paris. The staff is very friendly, the breakfast was good and was worth the money. The room was simple but clean. It's located opposite a metro station in Montparnasse. If I would go to Paris again, I'll be staying there -it's worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good big city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luv_Travel_N0t_W0rk
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in Paris for a few nights and booked this hotel based on availability and reviews from tripadvisor. Our experience confirms much of what we read here. The hotel is well located to the Metro and some great bakeries across the road with restaurants not too far away (the bar downstairs even does ok food and good people watching drinks with great service). The size is as most other Paris and European city hotels and, typical of other Paris stays in this class of hotel, the walls can be a little thin and those above having late night showers can generate a lot of noise through pipes. However it suits the need given the price. Furthermore the staff were happy to help as required - particularly when we were impacted by the Eurostar tunnel fire. Happy to recommend hotel Innova.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit”
Reviews.Author: papabearCarnoustie
Reviews.Content: We first satyed here in September last year and had a great time. So when we deicded to visit Paris again there was no hesitation to book once more. The hotel is in a fantastic location with a Metro just yards from the door. This allows easy and very cheap transport to anywhere in Paris. I can't reccomend the Metro highly enough. It is cheap (buy the carnet tickets, a book of ten) punctual, clean and safe. It is currently under going a major refurbishment at the moment so the occasional station may be closed but free busses are laid on Staff in the hotel are brilliant. the desk staff are extremely helpful, their English is far better than my French and they are always on hand to help. The domestic staff do a great job. Cheerful and the rooms get cleaned + new towels every day. The rooms are freshly decorated, the lift new and a lovely smell of leather from the new furniture in the reception. Within a 5 minute walk there loads of cafes, resturants, fruit shops, small supermarkets, pharmacies. All the major tourist attractions are no more than 15 mins by metro away. For the money you'll be hard pressed to find better. It's the perfect base.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough about this Hotel! - Please read about lost wallet!!!”
Reviews.Author: hostilehosteler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Innova is terrific. It was my runner up for a trip last december, and I was glad I got to stay there this time. My girfriend and I stayed for a couple nights and everything was great. They were renovating the lobby when we stayed, and it looked like it would be very nice when finished. The rooms were nice, and the elevator was newly renovated. It's easy to see that they are putting a lot into the place. Breakfast on the 1st floor was very good, and they also offer free internet in the lobby. The best part - I left my wallet in the nightstand, and the manager went way out of his way to get it back to me. If you're a frequent traveller and have ever left something in a room, you know how hard it is to get it back. Well, the housekeeper found it and gave it to the manager, who then called my us cell phone and emailed me, before I even noticed it was gone. We took the TGV to the south of france that morning, and arranged to have DHL pick it up. He put the wallet in an envelope inside another envelope and sent it back, everything inside. My GF and I both speak french and had a good time in France, but as always, there were a few times when we struggled with the 'indifference' french people in service businesses show to travelers. That's why we were so amazed with the extra effort and professionalism the hotel showed. I would definintely recommend that you stay at the Innova.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money, very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: sagaty
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at Hotel Innova for 4 nights and we arrived back in Ireland today. I have to recommend the hotel on its cleanliness, friendly staff and location in relation to the metro. The room that we stayed in was not that small and was exceptional clean, with a very powerful shower. When we request information for our daily trips the staff were very informative. The metro is right across the street, which will take you to the Champs Elysees in 10m mins. I would definitely go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved The Innova!”
Reviews.Author: patriciaxoxo
Reviews.Content: We absolutely LOVED our stay at the Innova. Its location was beneficial to us since we had to leave for Lourdes via Gare Montparnasse and it was just 5 minutes walk away. We were 5 travelling and asked for a twin and triple rooms, preferably with a view of the Eiffel tower. We were given a quadruple room and one of the rooms had a view of the Eiffel!! The people running this hotel are very considerate towards personal requests and in a city as impersonal as Paris, that is a PLUS! The rooms and bathrooms are clean, we didn't need airconditioning since April is a delightful month climate-wise. One of the really nice thing about the area is that there are so many boulangeries and food shops and it is not in a touristy area so you can see the locals "do their thing" everyday. The metro is just across the street and being newbies to Paris we didn't find it hard to use the subway at all. Everyone speaks English so no problem in that area. And since we had to leave for Lourdes~ their luggage storage facility is a bonus. All in all I would rate our stay at this hotel a 9+. Only the receiving area is old and needs to be refurbished. Otherwise, everything is great. We would stay there again and would gladly recommend the hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Judith_Sansom
Reviews.Content: My 12-year-old daughter and I spent 3 nights at the Innova in Feb 2008. It was her first trip to Paris, my first for many years, and the hotel was just right - friendly, safe, very clean bathroom with super shower and best of all a balcony view over bustling Avenue Pasteur which delighted my daughter. Patisserie opposite for breakfast. Very convenient for Metro - just 10 mins to Eiffel Tower. Booking via the hotel's website gave us the best rate. Our recommendations for getting around- the batobus - about 14 euros for a day ticket for an adult - cheaper than the Bateaux Mouches etc and no annoying commentary. We also took ordinary buses (not Opentour etc). You can use metro tickets on the bus and there are some great routes eg Route 73 takes you from Musee d'Orsay along Champs Elysees to La Defense. Useful website for planning metro/bus is ratp.fr. What to see - we chickened out of the Louvre as it is HUGE but the Musee dOrsay is enjoyable in a couple of hours. The cafe is cramped so take a snack. For cheap touristy shops try the road leading away from Notre Dame: lots of choice! Get to Montmartre by 11 am and you will have your pick of artists to draw your picture and they will give you a good price. We were fascinated by pet shops along north side of Seine: start from La Samaritaine (famous but closed department store) and walk along towards Hotel de Ville.

Reviews.Title: “good value and perfectly fine”
Reviews.Author: EMNC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Innova for 2 nights in mid-February. We took the Air France bus from Charles DeGaulle to the Montparnasse train station and walked to the hotel (maybe a ten mnute walk?). The hotel is in a good, safe neighborhood and is a short block from the Pasteur Metro station. We took the Metro everywhere. We had two rooms: one with a double bed for me and my husband and one with twin beds for our two teenage daughters. Both rooms were small, but the twin room was a little bigger. The rooms and bathrooms were very clean (and I can be very picky about that kind of thing). The common areas of the hotel seemed a little worn, but were also very clean. The breakfast was good, but a little expensive. We had it both mornings because it was fast and easy. We ate dinner one night in the neighborhood, at a not-too-great pizza place, but there were many better options. I liked the neighborhood because it was not too touristy. It was fascinating to watch the real Parisians from the area hurrying to work in the morning. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: joyandscottwpkcwby
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Innova (http://www.innova-paris-hotel.com)was exactly what I expected after reading the other reviews on this site. It was about 10 - 15 minutes from the center of Paris and has a Metro station right in front of the hotel (Pasteur Station off the 6 or 12 line). We booked the twin room (two twin beds) and were very happy with the room when we arrived. The room had two twin beds, a small closet, a flat screen tv with 10 channels (2 were in English - CNN and MTV), and a large bathroom. The bathroom was a great surprise for us with a tub and nice shower. It also had a towel warmer in th bathroom. My advice is to take a sound soother machine as we did - it drowns out any loud neighbors which we had. The concierge (all of them) were very helpful at all times. They helped us get our baggage that the airline lost, make dinner reservations, find locations on a map and reserved us a taxi to the airport. The lobby could use a little updating but for the money you can't beat this hotel. We highly recommend it. I would also recommend getting a 5-day metro pass if visiting the city - it costs around 45 Euro. Also, learn how to order a carafe of water in French - you will save a ton of money. There is a great restaurant across the street and down on the corner that had a nice breakfast. If you want a true Paris experience - take a dinner cruise or make reservations at Altitude 95 (Restaurant in the Eiffel Tower).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: s004mjo
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Innova was excellent. The double room we stayed in was small but perfect for my wife and I (both 27 years old). The room was clean and well maintained. We booked last minute via the hotel's website directly, which was very easy. The best part about staying at Hotel Innova is its proximity to the Pasteur metro stop. It made traveling around Paris a breeze. I would stay here again for future stays in Paris without hesitation. If you are looking for something simple, affordable with an excellent location, you should consider looking into this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: jestie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Innova is a cheap and cheerful hotel in Paris. It was exactly what we were looking for - clean, centrally located and reasonably priced. The room we had was small, but comfortable. It was a 1 minute walk from Pasteur metro station - this was easily accessible from the Gare du Nord. It was located close enough distance from the tourist sites (10 mins to Invalides, 20 mins to Eiffel Tower etc), but with the charm of coming across local markets and parks on the way. What we liked was that it was a bit off the tourist track - there were lots of Parisiennes buying their bread, vegetables and meat from the local shops. We felt like we were experiencing the real Paris. There is a great cafe across the road (Cafe Pasteur) that does a great breakfast for 7.50 Euros - cheaper than the hotel. All in all it was great value for a two star hotel in Paris. We would totally recommend it to people wanting a nice weekend in Paris, but without breaking the budget on accomodation. Because how much time do you want to spend in your room in a city as fantastic as Paris anyway?!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Innova - A winner!”
Reviews.Author: aaa-Moo
Reviews.Content: Going to Paris for the first time i didnt know which hotel to book. Based on other reviews i choose Hotel Innova and was not dissapointed. Staff- Excellent!! Always helpful with sound advice on where to eat and where to visit. Rooms- Clean, tidy and cosy. I bit small but i assume everything is small unless you stay at the Hilton. Nice view also. Cost- Bargain!! Location- I really liked the location of the hotel. Right outside the Metro for trips into the city (10 mins). Walking distance to the Ivalides and Eifell tower. This hotel is not located in a 'touristy' area which is nice because you get a more 'local' experience. The nearby bars and restaurants are excellent!! Easy to get to from CDG. Overall- Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but Far from Tourist Central”
Reviews.Author: Lord_Squishington
Reviews.Content: The Innova was a clean and friendly hotel, unfortunately just too far from everything for us. We stayed here late January 2008, and found it took a good 20 minute walk to Hotel Invalids or the Eiffel Tower; and from there a further walk to anything else touristy. You can certainly take the Metro (which was right outside), but this costs money – and money is always tight on any holiday! An internet terminal is available at the hotel, though at-cost (and expensive) – you’re better off finding an internet cafe elsewhere. Breakfast is available at the hotel, though is not included in the room cost –8 Euro’s per person per day, which is excessive and REALLY not worth the money. For that you get a small selection (2 types) of savouries, yogurt, corn flakes and tea/coffee – buffet style, but a very small selection available. We spent about 8-10 Euro for two of us across the road at the local patisserie, which has a wider selection and better foods available. Clean, comfortable, but not the best of locations and with a pretty crap and expensive breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: ameliex
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in January and would definately stay there again. The hotel was spotless, and the room looked recently redecorated. It wasn't a huge room, but by Paris standards it was plently big enough for 2. The breakfast unfornately wasn't buffet style, you sit down and there is already a plate with a croissant, small baguette and a pastry. A lady will bring you coffee, tea or chocolate. You can help yourself to cereal and yoghurt and juice. There is a metro opposite and its not far from the train station., about 5 minutes. There are loads of restaurants within 10 minutes walk. The area seems pretty safe too. Overall I was very happy with our stay here, the only reason I wouldn't stay again would be I would rather stay in a more central area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: charmays
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the staff, the room and the location! It is not fancy but has a charm about it. Jean Pierre who manages the front desk during the day is one of the most charming hotel managers we have every met. He gives five star service.
