He was able to direct us to good and reasonable places to eat. He always called ahead to make sure they were open. I would stay here again in a minute and I am very picky!

Reviews.Title: “As promised!”
Reviews.Author: annagolightly
Reviews.Content: I booked a night in hotel Innova on the basis of Tripadvisor reviews and was not disappointed: exceedingly friendly staff, good breakfast for only 8 euro, perfect connections through two metro lines stopping in front of the hotel (Pasteur station), easy and lovely walk to Tour Eiffel and nearby museums. Room is small but well appointed, good bed, good shower, only bother was noise from neighbouring (bath)room. Certainly great value for money, as promised by the reviews. A practical solution for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem !”
Reviews.Author: innaMontreal
Reviews.Content: My teen daughter and I loved this hotel. We stayed for a week at the end of Oct./07. The place is really clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is a good start, fresh orange and grapefruit juices, fresh delicious rolls, croissants and baguette, corn flakes, jams, honey, emmental cheese ... it's buffet style but coffee, tea, or hot chocolate are served to you at your table. The location is quite convenient. The Pasteur subway station is right across the street. From Pasteur to Passy the train runs above ground. The 95 bus goes to St-Germain des-Prés, the Louvre, and Opéra Garnier (direction Pte de Montmarte). The 70 bus goes to Ile de la Cité (direction Hotel de Ville). We felt safe in the area even when returning past midnight. I would definatly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: marksmissus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just got back from staying at this great hotel and had a wonderful time.We decided to stay here after reading all the reviews about it on Trip Advisor and we wern't dissapointed.The receptionist was warm, welcoming and informative.Our room was right next door to the lift which we thought might prove to be a bit noisy but this wasn't the case.the rooms appear to be pretty well soundproofed.The double glazing was also excellent-the hotel is on a busy street but once the window was shut all you could here was a slight murmur,nothing intrusive.The room itself was lovely.Yes,it was small,but not uncomfortably small-we've stayed in much smaller in Paris so to us this was quite spacious.It was very clean and the en suite was equally as clean.The room was cleaned to a very high standard each day.As we booked through a travel agent we had breakfast included in our package and were very happy with it-the food was lovely and the waitress was great. The hotel is situated in a good area-only about 5 minutes walk from the Montparnasse tower,which we could see from our bedroom window and opposite Pasteur metro station.It is also only a 5 minute walk from the nearest L'open tour bus stop which was very handy. There was nothing we disliked about this hotel and will absolutely definately stay here again when we return to Paris.Very highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: farside8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days in September during the Rugby and found it to be in a wonderful location (about 50 metres from the Pasteur metro station), with a few great cafes in very close proximity. 3 stations from the eiffel tower - very easy to get around Paris. Rooms were comfortable and whilst not palatial, they were spacious enough with a good ensuite. Very clean, 24 hour internet access and very friendly and helpful staff. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: BaldinoLondon
Reviews.Content: Booked in this place for a Rugby World Cup game when the city was really booked up. This place is in a great location with great links on the metro. Rooms are basic but clean. I'd suggest spending a few extra euros on a double even if you are on your own . I had a great view of the Eiffel Tower from my window which was a bonus. Breakfast was fine, staff were friendly. Overall, for a couple of nights this place is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean, friendly little spot in Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: idayvuelta
Reviews.Content: Wow, we stayed at the Hotel Innova in the Montparnasse business district in Paris, and we loved it! It was very easy to get there from the Airport (you take the train, about eight euros, from the airport to the Metro, 1.25 euros, and then it was only a few stops on the #6 line to Pasteur station, and then just a few steps to the hotel) The manager of the hotel was exceptionally friendly, we had a nice room with a massive, clean and modern bathroom. The evening clerk was also very friendly and helpful. The room itself was small, but we didn't go there to sit in the room. It was very easy to walk to everywhere from there ... and if you don't like to walk, then the Metro is right there, and very easy to use. We loved it! We will stay at the Innova again! Vik

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: kopalk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in Nov/06. Loved the location and room which was small but great. Metro just opposite hotel which is fantastic. Lovely sight of Eiffel down the road...

Reviews.Title: “Great service -Great location”
Reviews.Author: vsaldez
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 12 days at the Hotel Innova in August 2007. We would stay there again. Pros: 1. Friendly and very helpful staff that speak very good English 2. 24 hour internet service 3. Excellent location as the hotel is located right at the metro station 4. Numerous grocery stores, coffee shops, pastry shops and restaurants nearby 5. Walking distance to many major sightseeing areas 6. Excellent value for money -the rooms are small but you have your own bathroom and the rooms are clean and made up daily Cons: 1. The bed was not the most comfortable, however clean 2. Not all rooms have air conditioning and if it is hot out, the room will be hot (however they all have balcony doors) 3. Do not recommend the breakfast as for 8 Euros, you will get coffee and juice, a croissant and a bun.....there is a coffee shop right next door with very friendly service (also there is also another nice coffee shop across the street but some of the waiters tend to have the Paris attitude) However, for every cons one must remember that the price of the hotel for what you get is excellent. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and we would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Innova was great!”
Reviews.Author: 2_Months_In_Europe
Reviews.Content: Hotel Innova 32 Boulevard Pasteur 75015 Paris, France There are 2 Hotel Innova’s, so make sure you’re reading about the right one! My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel Innova from June 29-July 3. I had been to Paris before and stayed at the horrendously over-priced and extremely unsatisfactory Tim Hotel, so I was pretty concerned about what we would end up with. Fortunately, we were very pleasantly surprised! Our room was beautiful and clean with windows that opened to the street (wonderful for people watching). The room was fairly standard (a double bed, desk, TV, phone and bathroom/shower) but we were quite happy with everything about it! The hotel is directly across from a subway stop, making transportation convenient. As well, it is about a 20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, a short walk to a grocery store, and a short walk to the Gare Montparnasse (Train Station). The hotel has an elevator, a computer with internet available for guests, and 24 hour reception. I saw comments on other reviews saying that the staff was not friendly, but that was not our experience at all. Everyone we dealt with was very friendly and helpful. It may have helped that we could speak a bit of French, but I think if you spend any time at all in Paris, you will come to realize that people in general are not friendly towards tourists, however if you attempt to speak their language, and do not assume that they should be able to speak yours, then you will be treated much better.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: flyingfingers-7
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on the website [-----] and kept going back to it, as I couldn't believe the nice things that other people were saying about it. It's a hostel that's been converted into a hotel, and after paying $150/night in Venice for an ancient room that hasn't been updated since it was built, I was scared to see what we'd end up with in Paris for $100/night. Well, we got a private room with a private washroom on the 7th floor (yes, there's an elevator) with a view of the Arc d'Triomphe and the Sacre Couer in the distance. There was a TV, telephone and air conditioning (although we didn't use them) and there was a computer in the lobby that we used (2 Euros for 15 min; 3 Euros for 1/2 hour). The hotel is right across the street from the Pasteur Metro station so we went everywhere by Metro. Purchase a Carte Orange card - it costs 15 Euros and is good for all Metro and buses for an entire week. (The hotel staff will photocopy your passport picture for your "photo ID"). Breakfast isn't included, but there's a great creperie one block away. For the price, this hotel was perfect for this mother travelling with her teenaged daughter!

Reviews.Title: “Great Views of the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: AmyTravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel has amazing views of the Eiffel Tower and all you have to do to get a room with a view is to email them! They are very friendly and helpful and recommended many great places to eat. The hotel is centrally located and you need only to cross the street to catch a bus or walk a couple blocks for the rail. This paris hotel was great. Paris itself is overrated.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: cand1781
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Innova the first week of July 2007. The room was a typical hotel European hotel room (smaller room, smaller bath, etc.) The location is not entirely convenient with relation to the major sites. However, if you enjoy walking, it might be ok, I would map it out first. There is a metro stop just outside the hotel which was great for us because after the first few days of walking to everything, we needed a break. The metro is a wonderful tool to navigate through Paris. It is very easy to use once you figure it out after a few times. If you plan on using the metro often, do yourself a favor and buy in bulk. We bought a 20-pack of metro tickets for 21.20 Euro (or there about) when a one-way ticket is 1.5 Euro each. Back to the hotel----house keeping was good. The sheets and towels were changed daily. There is an elevator in the hotel, so getting luggage upstairs was not a problem. We did have a room that faced the street which was quite noisy. However, after a long day of sight-seeing, falling asleep was not really a problem. Also, the windows were pretty sound-proof, but being that there is no air-conditioning, we had to keep the windows open. And don't get the breakfast at the hotel. It is 7 Euros per person. There are soooo many shops you will pass where you can buy delicious and fresh pastries for MUCH less---we would buy 4 croissants for about 2 or 3 Euro, for the two of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of teh Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Tenterfield_Saddler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Innova for 5 nights in June. Three of us shared a triple room, which was a bit cramped with all our luggage (we had a lot of luggage). We were pleasantly surprised to have an excellent view of the Eiffel Tower from the top floor. (They only have a few rooms like that) We didn't order an airconditioned room but didn't need one in June (coming from a warm climate). The room was clean, and about average size for Paris. The bathroom was modern and a reasonable size for the price. The Day staff couldn't have been more helpful, but there was just one guy (who worked nights) who had an attitude. The breakfasts were good, but basic. The breakfast staff didn't speak English, but receptionists all spoke good English. It's in a nice enough part of Paris, and very handy for facilities. There is an excellent Patisserie across the street, and a good bar/ bistro at the corner just down from it (service was lightning speed). There is also a laundry about a block away. We tried most eateries in the area (including fast food) and didn't have any complaints). The crepes were beautiful. They have just one busy internet computer at the hotel, but there is an Internet cafe one street down towards the Pasteur Station (turn left and it's a couple of blocks). Watch out for the motorbike lane when crossing the Boulevard Pasteur ! We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bon”
Reviews.Author: snifferdog
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a relatively cheap place to stay in Paris, this hotel is as good a place to stay as any. Located just across the road from the Pasteur Metro station, it's minutes away from the main tourist attractions in Paris. The room we stayed in was clean and comfortable. At the end of the day, that's all you want. Why hang around in a hotel room when you're in the most exciting city in the world!

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are right”
Reviews.Author: HappyoutMeath
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend went to paris for 4 nights. We choose this hotel due to the reviews it received. We booked a superior room on the 7th floor 400e for both of us for 4 nights. The staff were lovely. The man on reception advised us to go to lavel restaurant which is only across the street and up the road. If you say you are staying in Hotel innova you get a glass of kir champagne free! (its 9.50e on menu. I have to sing the praises of a restuarant only doors down from the hotel 'manger la salle' something like that, but a 3 course meal is only 19e it is wonderful and the man running the place is so nice. I cant understand why people gave out about the lift it is bright mirror lined and modern. Fab FAB fab hotel hopefully going back in the sringtime. Great location you dont realise how good it is to have a metro station across the road until you get over there, i want to take the paris metro back home to Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, friendliest people in Paris”
Reviews.Author: xxvicki20xx
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was lovely, the staff were the friendliest people I met in Paris, they recomended things to see and do. the location is good, about twenty minute walk from the eiffel tower and les invalides and only two minutes away from loads of restaurants, cafes and bars . Do not get a pizza from the late night place that is next door dreadful!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: spoza
Reviews.Content: Spent only one night. Great value for money in a great location. As others have said double rooms on the small side but you are in Paris. Staff more than helpful. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Saucebrick
Reviews.Content: Hotel Innova, Paris. We stayed at the Innova for three nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. We had a third floor front room with en-suite, and although our accommodation was fairly compact it suited our needs perfectly. The bedroom consisted of a double bed, wardrobe, two small tables with two chairs, and the en-suite was fitted with a powerful shower instead of a bath – which suited us just fine. In addition there was a colour TV and hair dryer provided. Our room had a small balcony that overlooked the main street; the access to the balcony was via a pair of new upvc double glazed French windows, which in turn were covered by drapes. Considering our room was at the front we weren’t really bothered by any traffic noise, it just seemed to be part of the normal background ambience. However, for an extra cost there are rooms available at the rear away from the main road for anyone wishing for that extra bit of piece and quiet! The room was cleaned and serviced daily to a high standard and we found most of the staff to be helpful and friendly, especially the French gentleman (I think he may have been the manager) who was on duty in the mornings. The location of this hotel was excellent, in the immediate vicinity there are plenty of shops of all descriptions including cafes, bars, restaurants, supermarkets, pharmacies etc. Just over the road from the hotel is Pasteur Metro, which in turn links you up to anywhere within the city. Most times we would walk to the major attractions located alongside the river and enjoy the unexpected sights along the way. An easy stroll to the Invalides or the Eiffel Tower would take about 15/20 minutes. The whole area around the hotel felt safe and there wasn’t any sense of aggression or intimidation even later on in the night, in fact we found most of Paris to be the same. We didn’t really have any complaints considering we were staying in Paris in a low cost two star hotel – although a very good two star! Okay, the bathroom was a bit small but if you want a huge apartment you have to be prepared to spend a lot more and we found it perfectly adequate anyway. I guess it would have been just right if the room was fitted with a small fridge in order for us to store drinks etc. but that is only a minor fault. As an afterthought, if we stayed again at this time of year (July) and the weather was just as hot I think I would spend the extra few Euros for a room with air-con; as it was, we just left the balcony window open – no problems. Next time we visit Paris we would definitely stay there again, and recommend the Innova to like minded travellers who just need a base to rest and recuperate while enjoying this marvellous city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: DuffCT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Innova for 4 nights at the end of June. My husband and I shared a family room with our 2 daughters, our first trip to Paris. We were really pleased with the hotel, which we had chosen over the Internet, with help from Trip Advisor. It's in a very good location, with an underground stop right outside, cafe's all around, supermarkets, etc. We had a wonderful time in Paris! Would definitely stay in this hotel again. One tip for future tourists - bring along some little plastic bowls and some cutlery sets, get food at the local supermarkets, and you'll save a lot of money and have fun picnicing in the bargain.
